explanation.rules:
Rules:
• Word order is S (O′) O V (S = subject, O′ = indirect object, O = direct object, V = predicate).
• Noun number markers: singular = ∅; plural = ‑i (after a consonant) or ‑cci (after a vowel).
• Noun case markers: subject = ∅; O′/O = ‑zg (after a vowel), ‑gi (after a sonorant), ‑ki (after an obstruent).
• Verb tense prefixes: present a‑, future bi‑.
• Verb root follows the tense prefix.
• Verb ‘to give’: root dem when recipient is 1st person, root tir when recipient is 2nd/3rd person.
• Object suffix set: if an indirect object (O′) is present → singular ∅, plural ‑ccir (‑C > ∅ | ‑ccir); otherwise for direct object → singular ∅, plural ‑ir.
• Finite‑verb tense suffixes: past ‑s; present/future ‑r (with r → d after n).
• Subject agreement suffixes: 1 sg ‑i; 1 pl / 3 sg ‑u; 3 pl ‑a.
